results.title: On my own
results.creator_credit: Antonio Tibaldi, Elisa Resegotti, Les Pescarolo, Alliance Communications, Ellepi Films and Rosa Colosimo Productions
results.brief_description: Simon (Matthew Ferguson), an adolescent at an elite Canadian boarding school, is looking forward to spending his Christmas holidays with his divorced parents. When he arrives in Toronto he discovers that his mother has been hospitalised and, for the first time, is told of her schizophrenia. This intimate drama, shot in the beautiful light of a north Canadian winter, is powerfully acted by Ferguson and by Judy Davis as the mother. Simon’s growing awareness of his mother’s illness results in his alienation from the concerns of his fellow classmates, and he becomes close to an older boy who initiates him into the rites of adulthood. This Australian, Canadian and Italian co-production was nominated for 6 AFI awards including Best Film.

results.title: Little women
results.brief_description: Louisa May Alcott’s popular novel is brought vividly to life in this second screen adaption of “Little Women.” The March sisters are Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Janet Leigh), Amy (a blonde Elizabeth Taylor) and Meg (child-star Margaret O’Brien). Their father has left for the Civil War, leaving the girls under the watchful eye of their mother (Mary Astor). Far removed from war and safe within their New England home, the “little women” are a closely-knit family and a picture of happiness. When Laurie (Peter Lawford), the grandson of a rich neighbor arrives, the orderly world of the March family is disrupted. The sisters are smitten by this handsome stranger and a story of romance, rivalry, love and loss ensues. As the high spirited and determined Jo, June Allyson gives one of the finest performances of her career, ably supported by the superb ensemble cast. The film is beautifully crafted and deservedly received an Academy Award nomination for its exceptional cinematography. Co-starring Rossano Brazzi as Professor Bhaer.

results.title: Forty thousand horsemen
results.creator_credit: Charles Chauvel and Famous Feature Films
results.brief_description: Forty thousand horsemen is set during World War 1 and deals with the exploits of the Australian Light Horse in Palestine. Chauvel’s uncle, who led the actual charge at Beersheba, was the inspiration for this acclaimed historical recreation. The film is unapologetically intensly nationalistic, viewed through the eyes of three Anzacs, Red (Grant Taylor), Larry (Pat Twohill) and Jim (Chips Rafferty). This internationally successful film established Chips Rafferty’s laconic bushman stereotype for which he became renown and established Chauvel as a world class director.

results.title: Cat people
results.creator_credit: Paul Schrader, Charles Fries, RKO Radio Pictures and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A re-make of the 1942 horror classic starring Nastassia Kinski, Malcolm McDowell and John Heard. Irena is a beautiful young woman on the brink of exploring her sexuality. The experience brings tragic consequences and pushes her towards her bizarre destiny as her past and present collide. The orginal story held that an ancient race of women mated with big cats in the dawn of time. To become human again after mating, the “Cat people” must kill. Irena, who is in love with a human is condemned to repeat the patterns of her ancestors.

results.title: The Big red one
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Gene Corman, Lorimar Film Entertainment and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: The combat Sergeant’s duty is to make sure that the men under his charge stay alive. Some of them are barely out of high school and must face the mental and physical challenges of war. The First Infantry Division’s insignia is named the “Big Red One’. The men in this division battle their way through North Africa, Sicily, Omaha Beach and Belgium until they confront the horrors of the Nazi Death Camps. Lee Marvin is the Sergeant, joined by Mark Hamill and Robert Carradine in this excellent portrayal of the realities and horror of war.

results.title: Saturday night fever
results.creator_credit: John Badham, Robert Stigwood and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: John Travolta and Karen Gorney star in the film that brought the “seventies generation” out of their homes and into the disco wearing gaberdine pants and platform shoes. After a week of work in a hardware store, Tony transforms himself into the local Disco King. His new dance partner Stephanie, and ex-priest brother, has Tony questioning the shallowness of his life. It is a fine piece of cinema, being not simply a disco dance, but a striking social commentary. The film is memorable for its great soundtrack; the original music being performed and written by the Bee Gees, for the excellence of the dancing and a fantastic performance from Travolta. A must for those who want to re-live a bygone era and connoisseurs of fashion.

results.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
results.creator_credit: Stephan Elliott, Al Clark, Michael Hamlyn, Latent Image and Specific Films
results.brief_description: When drag queen Anthony (Hugo Weaving) takes his act on the road with fellow cross-dresser Adam (Guy Pearce) and transsexual Bernadette (Terence Stamp). In their colorful bus, Priscilla, the three performers travel across the Australian desert performing for enthusiastic crowds and homophobic locals.

constellations_primary.name: Joy of drag
constellations_primary.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Gender transcending larrikins
constellations_other.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

constellations_other.name: Hiding in plain sight
constellations_other.description: This print of upside-down heads is an early optical illusion featuring hidden characters. Movie studios have continued the tradition of playing with perspective in the bold designs, vivid colours and hidden meanings of film posters.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

recommendations.quote: The film's three leads have all swapped fabulous frocks for villainous outfits in superhero films. Terrance Stamp was Zod in Superman 2, Hugo Weaving was Red Skull in Captain America: The First Avenger and Guy Pearce was Aldrich Killian in Iron Man 3.

results.title_for_label: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephan Elliott, Al Clark, Michael Hamlyn, Latent Image and Specific Films
results.description:
This incredibly successful Australian comedy traces the adventures of three Sydney drag queens who travel through the Australian outback in order to perform their exuberant act in Alice Springs.

On their journey through the desert, on a bus christened Priscilla, they encounter both friendship and enmity from the small bush communities. Guy Pearce is excellent as the youngest drag queen who has a tough mouth but a lot to learn about the world, while Hugo Weaving is moving as a man who must reveal the truth of his homosexuality to his son. Terence Stamp is unforgettable as the transgendered Bernice and the loving relationship that develops between Stamp and Bill Hunter’s outback “bloke” is very tender and touching.

Full of humour, colour and bizarre costumes for which the film won an Academy Award, Priscilla is a wickedly entrancing family movie which shows that not only Australian cities but the mythical Australian bush has been affected and changed by ethnic and sexual multiculturalism. The soundtrack is full of great drag disco classics from ‘I Will Survive’ and ‘Go West’ to the more recent ‘Finally’ and ‘Save the Best for Last’.

results.title: Horse feathers
results.brief_description: Groucho, Harpo, Chico and Zeppo star in this anarchic parody of college life. As the President of Huxley College, Groucho is busy keeping his eye on the students, as well as on the curves of vivacious college widow Thelma Todd. She is secretly trying to find the secret football codes to sell to rival college Darwin. “Horse Feathers” includes the riotious classroom war scene and the climatic football game finale where all the rules are broken!

results.title: Basic instinct (E)
results.creator_credit: Paul Verhoeven, Alan Marshall, Carolco Pictures and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: Destined to become a modern classic, Paul Verhoeven’s effort has brought new definition and brilliance to the “femme fatale” of the film noir genre. It is all here, temptation, sex and murder, and all in the guise of a voluptuous beautiful woman. Michael Douglas plays an ex-undercover cop, burnt out and recovering from drug and alcohol addiction when he becomes involved with the investigation of a brutal murder. The prime suspect is a very rich, very beautiful young woman (Sharon Stone) who’s calm and collected exterior belies a predatory and hedonistic soul. Shocking, controversial and explicit, this is not a film for the squeamish. Co-starring George Dzundza.

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Sam Spiegel, Columbia, Horizon (GB) and Horizon (US)
results.brief_description: A dazzling cast, with Michael Jayston and Janet Suzman playing the lead roles of the ill-fated Czar Nicholas II, and the Czarina Alexandra. Born to be one of the world’s most powerful men, Nicholas ruled millions of people with an empire stretching over one-sixth of the globe. His belief in the Divine Right to rule, made him oblivious to the hardships endured by many of his subjects who were ready to embrace the powerful ideals proposed by Lenin and his followers. The Czarina, in a desperate bid to find a cure for their haemophiliac son, relies heavily on the seductive and mysterious “Mad Monk” Rasputin. Once Lenin and his Bolsheviks gain power, the Royal Family is doomed. “Nicholas and Alexandra” is filled with the pomp and pageantry of history’s great events.
